Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: Draw basic shapes that might represent land or water environments, but lacks clarity or distinction between them.
Include a few simple illustrations of living things, such as a basic tree or a fish, without variety or detail.
CANNOT: Distinctly represent two different habitats with clear features to differentiate land from water (student may confuse land with water or vice versa).
Include a variety of living things with clear identification (student may only draw one or two types and not recognize them as different species).
Make comparisons between living things in each habitat (student may not attempt or may not understand the concept of comparison between habitats).
Show patterns in plant and animal diversity (student does not recognize differences or environmental influences on living things).
Provide accurate labels or captions to describe the habitats and living things (student may either omit labels or label them incorrectly, e.g., a fish might be labeled as a bird).
Organize the drawing to clearly display different plants and animals in each habitat (student's drawing may be chaotic or elements may be misplaced).
